verses.roman:
parakīyā-bhāve ati rasera ullāsa
vraja vinā ihāra anyatra nāhi vāsa

synonyms: parakīyā-bhāve—in the mood of parakīyā, or conjugal relations outside of marriage; ati—very great; rasera—of mellow; ullāsa—increase; vraja vinā—except for Vraja; ihāra—of this; anyatra—anywhere else; nāhi—there is not; vāsa—residence.
translation: There is a great increase of mellow in the unwedded conjugal mood. Such love is found nowhere but in Vraja.
